article.title: Direct Photon Production and Azimuthal Anisotropy at Low Transverse Momentum measured in PHENIX

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the dashed line in Figure 1 represent?
choices: Electron trajectory
Photon trajectory
Magnetic field lines
Energy deposit

multiple_choice_question.text: Which method generally achieves a lower p<sub>T</sub> reach for measuring inclusive photon v<sub>n</sub>?
choices: Calorimeter method
Conversion method
Both methods have the same p<sub>T</sub> reach
Cannot be determined from the figure

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of showing the ratio of measured v<sub>2</sub> and v<sub>3</sub> values to the averaged values in panels (b) and (d)?
choices: To compare the anisotropy of charged and neutral pions directly.
To highlight the systematic uncertainties in the measurements.
To demonstrate the validity of the scaling used to derive v<sub>n</sub> for heavier mesons.
To show the centrality dependence of pion anisotropy.

multiple_choice_question.text: What can be concluded about the centrality dependence of direct photon v<sub>3</sub> based on the data presented?
choices: v<sub>3</sub> increases with centrality.
v<sub>3</sub> decreases with centrality.
There is no clear centrality dependence for v<sub>3</sub>.
The centrality dependence of v<sub>3</sub> cannot be determined from the figure.
Calculation of direct photon v<sub>n</sub>
Estimation of decay photon v<sub>n</sub>
Scaling of pion v<sub>n</sub> to derive v<sub>n</sub> for heavier mesons
Calculation of the invariant mass of e<sup>+</sup>e<sup>-</sup> pairs
